8-2-14: INTERPRETATION:
This chapter shall be so interpreted and construed as to effectuate its general purpose to make uniform the terms and conditions for the provision
of sanitary sewer services by the Town of Erie. (Ord. 21-2005, 4-12-2005)
Chapter 3
WATER AND WASTEWATER ENTERPRISES
8-3-1: WATER ACTIVITY ENTERPRISE:
A. Continuance Of Water Activity Enterprise: The town of Erie shall continue to maintain its water activity enterprise as it relates to water services
(as that term is defined at Colorado Revised Statutes section 37-45.1-102[4]) for the purpose of pursuing and continuing water activities as they
relate to water purposes (as that term is defined at Colorado Revised Statutes section 37-45.1-102[3]), including, but not limited to, the
acquisition, diversion, storage, carriage, delivery, distribution, collection, treatment, use, reuse, augmentation, exchange and discharge of water
including the provision of wholesale or retail water and the acquisition of water or water rights. The enterprise is authorized to use, operate,
improve, extend, enlarge, repair, replace, acquire, dispose of, encumber, contract with respect to, and otherwise control and supervise all water
facilities and property owned by the town of Erie. All facilities, property and assets which are utilized by the enterprise, or form a part of the
enterprise, shall be the property of the town of Erie and upon termination of the enterprise, shall be returned to the town of Erie.
B. Power To Levy Or Assess Any Tax: In no event shall the enterprise have the power to levy or assess any tax which is subject to article X,
section 20, of the state constitution or to direct the town of Erie to exercise its taxing powers on behalf of the enterprise.
C. Revenue Bonds: The enterprise shall have the authority to issue its own revenue bonds without an election and shall have all powers and
authorities granted to water activity enterprises by state law.
D. Ownership Of Enterprise: The Erie water activity enterprise described herein has been, and remains, wholly owned by the town of Erie and the
governing body of this water activity enterprise has been, and will continue to be, the town of Erie board of trustees, which is the governing
body of the town of Erie.
E. Revenues: All revenues of the enterprise shall be deposited into, and all expenses of the enterprise shall be paid from, the water fund or such
other funds as may be created by the town of Erie board of trustees, such deposits and payments to be in accordance with the policies and
ordinances of the town of Erie board of trustees. The monies in each of the funds established for the enterprise may be commingled with any
other monies of the town of Erie, but the funds shall be separately accounted for.
F. Instrumentality: The enterprise shall be deemed to be an "instrumentality" of the town as such term is used in Colorado Revised Statutes section
24-10-103(5), and as such, is a "public entity" entitled to such benefits, burdens, and immunities as may be available to it under the Colorado
governmental immunity act, Colorado Revised Statutes section 24-10-101 et seq.
G. Immunity: It is declared by the town of Erie that the existence of immunity under the Colorado governmental immunity act is consistent with the
nature of a government owned business as the term is used in Colorado constitution, article X, section 20; that immunity from certain tort
liabilities are common for water activities; and that the mere existence of such immunity does not affect the status of the enterprise. In the
event, however, that a court of competent jurisdiction makes a final determination that application of the Colorado governmental immunity act
would disqualify the enterprise as an enterprise under Colorado constitution, article X, section 20, then the enterprise shall remain an
instrumentality of the town of Erie, and the Colorado governmental immunity act shall be deemed not to apply to the enterprise, and the
enterprise shall modify its duties and operations hereunder in any reasonable manner determined by the governing body in order to respond to
the effects of such determination.
H. Name Of Enterprise: The water activity enterprise related to water services shall from this day forward be called the Erie water activity
enterprise. (Ord. 03-2004, 9-14-2004)
8-3-2: WASTEWATER ENTERPRISE:
A. Enterprise Continued; Purpose: The town shall continue to maintain its water activity enterprise as it relates to wastewater services (as that term
is defined at Colorado Revised Statutes section 37-45.1-102 [4]) for the purpose of pursuing and continuing water activities as they relate to
wastewater purposes (as that term is defined at Colorado Revised Statutes section 37-45.1-102 [3]), including, but not limited to, the
management, operation, use and maintenance of the town's wastewater facilities and all other water activities and services. All facilities,
property and assets which are utilized by the enterprise, or form part of the enterprise, shall be the property of the town and, upon termination
of the enterprise, shall be returned to the town.
B. Powers And Restrictions: The enterprise is authorized to use, operate, improve, extend, enlarge, repair, replace, acquire, dispose of, encumber,
contract with respect to and otherwise control and supervise all wastewater facilities and property owned by the town. The enterprise shall also

enterprises by State law. In no event shall the enterprise have the power to levy or assess any tax which is subject to article X, section 20 of the

C. Ownership; Governing Body Of Enterprise: The water activity enterprise described herein has been, and remains, wholly owned by the town,
and the governing body of this water activity enterprise has been, and will continue to be, the town board of trustees, which is the governing

D. Disposition And Expenditure Of Revenues: All revenues of the enterprise shall be deposited into, and all expenses of the enterprise shall be
